headline: Under Armour earnings, Fed, Liftoff Mobile IPO: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Friday, February 6, including earnings results from Under Armour (UAA, UA), Biogen (BIIB), and Philip Morris (PM); commentary from Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson; and Liftoff Mobile making its public debut on the Nasdaq, trading under the ticker LFTO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: Under Armour earnings, Fed, Liftoff Mobile IPO: What to Watch

headline: Philip Morris International falls as Q4 results meet expectations
summary: Investing.com -- Philip Morris International Inc. (NYSE: PM) shares fell 2.8% after the tobacco giant reported fourth-quarter results that largely met analyst expectations, with adjusted earnings per share of $1.70 compared to the consensus estimate of $1.70, and revenue of $10.4 billion versus the expected $10.39 billion.

content.title: Philip Morris International falls as Q4 results meet expectations
content.summary: Investing.com -- Philip Morris International Inc. (NYSE: PM) shares fell 2.8% after the tobacco giant reported fourth-quarter results that largely met analyst expectations, with adjusted earnings per share of $1.70 compared to the consensus estimate of $1.70, and revenue of $10.4 billion versus the expected $10.39 billion.

headline: Philip Morris (NYSE:PM) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Tobacco company Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 6.8% year on year to $10.36 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.70 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Philip Morris (NYSE:PM) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates

headline: Philip Morris: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PM) on Friday reported fourth-quarter profit of $2.14 billion. The Stamford, Connecticut-based company said it had net income of $1.37 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $1.70 per share.

headline: Philip Morris (PM) Q4 2025 Earnings Transcript
summary: Jacek Olczak: Thank you, James, and welcome, everyone.  While the nicotine pouch category remains nascent in most geographies, Zen gained significant international share as we expanded the product portfolio and market reach.

content.title: Philip Morris (PM) Q4 2025 Earnings Transcript
content.summary: Jacek Olczak: Thank you, James, and welcome, everyone.  While the nicotine pouch category remains nascent in most geographies, Zen gained significant international share as we expanded the product portfolio and market reach.

headline: Philip Morris Stock Edges Up. Why Soft Revenue Isn’t a Drag for the Tobacco Giant.
summary: Philip Morris International  reported softer-than-expected quarterly revenue Friday, but the tobacco giant’s stock still edged higher.  Shares of the cigarette and Zyn nicotine pouch maker climbed 0.9% to $183.64.  The move came after Philip Morris reported adjusted earnings of $1.70 a share in the fourth quarter, as revenue climbed 6.8% from a year ago to $10.36 billion.

content.title: Philip Morris Stock Edges Up. Why Soft Revenue Isn’t a Drag for the Tobacco Giant.
content.summary: Philip Morris International  reported softer-than-expected quarterly revenue Friday, but the tobacco giant’s stock still edged higher.  Shares of the cigarette and Zyn nicotine pouch maker climbed 0.9% to $183.64.  The move came after Philip Morris reported adjusted earnings of $1.70 a share in the fourth quarter, as revenue climbed 6.8% from a year ago to $10.36 billion.
